intro: Beyeriopsis cinerea, commonly known as the gray beard plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive foliage and floral structure. It is native to southern Africa and is known for its hairy, grayish leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Beyeriopsis cinerea thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
